channel.title: Money and Tech
channel.description: Money and Tech is your one-stop source for the latest news on rapidly emerging innovations in the finance and tech sectors.

item.title: 7/16/14 - Google adds Bitcoin calculator, Ghash commits to 40%, & Coin Congress is next week
item.description: Google partners with Coinbase to add a BTC price tracker and calculator, Bitcoin Vietnam and Bit2C partner to launch VBTC exchange despite local government warnings, GHash commits to 40% hashrate cap at Bitcoin mining summit, a scam artist steals bitcoins and mining equipment from Digital Mining Investments and BTCJam, Elliptic announces $2 million seed-funding from Octopus Investments, TradeBlock reports $2.8 million funding led by Andreessen Horowitz, and Coin Congress is coming to San Francisco next week.

item.title: 7/10/14 - Bitcoin gets floating fees, Facebook shuts down Lecpetex & Coinfloor's new Knight
item.description: Gavin Andresen announces Bitcoin core protocol version 0.10, Andreas Antonopoulos resigns from the Bitcoin Foundation, Ross Ulbricht loses bid to dismiss Silk Road charges, Facebook takes down the “Lecpetex” botnet, Coinfloor appoints Adam Knight as new executive chairman, Netagio launches a new bitcoin-gold-sterling exchange, Mathias Sundin is the world's first political candidate to only accept campaign donations in Bitcoin, Argentina orders all financial institutions to “report operations performed with virtual coins,” and Hustler.com accepts Bitcoin through partnership with GoCoin.

item.title: 7/1/14 - US Marshals Service auction results, Newegg takes Bitcoin, and Beyoncé
item.description: The USMS reports a single winning bidder for their Friday bitcoin auction, 1-800-FLOWERS.COM announces it's accepting bitcoin, Newegg also accepting bitcoin payments with BitPay, Accenture launches its FinTech Innovation Lab program in Hong Kong, Moneero launches its new banking system ROX, Coinsetter holds 50% of its customer’s bitcoins in Xapo's fully-insured enterprise bitcoin vault storage, and The Chicago Sun-Times is launching a series of bitcoin-enabled QR code ads this week for an upcoming Beyoncé-Jay-Z concert tickets.

item.title: 5/27/14 - Bitcoin trading on Facebook, a rift at Ripple, and Serbia needs help
item.description: Kraken CEO Jesse Powell announces his resignation from the board of Ripple Labs, QuickCoin planning to to integrate it's "social wallet" with Facebook allowing users to send and recieve Bitcoin through the popular social media site, Spanish tax agency Agencia Estatal de Administraction Tributaria clarifies how digital currencies will be regulated and taxed, Polish Tax authorities clarified position on applicable tax for Bitcoin mining, New Zealand Bitcoin enthusiasts organizing the country's first cryptocurrency conference, Merriman Capital will be hosting an exclusive currency summit in San Francisco, Berkley School of Information students launch Serbianeedshelp.com to aide in flood relief, and the Bitcoin Beginners Fair will be held June 3rd at 20Mission in San Francisco.

item.title: 5/23/14 - Bitcoin passes $500 threshold, First law book on Bitcoin, & Charlie Shrem allowed outside
item.description: Bitcoin crosses the $500 threshold, Ripple XRP selloff sparks a price decline, Canadian lawyer Duhaime is writing the first law book on digital currency, Charlie Shrem is no longer under house arrest, CCEDK exchange is due to open later this month, General Bytes is ready to start shipping their new BATMTwo machines, and The Bitcoin Beginners Fair has been rescheduled to June 3rd.

item.title: 5/5/14 - Ripple in German banking, DOD investigates Bitcoin threat, BitPay's new "bits"
item.description: Today in Monday & Tech's Cinco de Mayo news updates, German bank Fidor is first to integrate the Ripple payment protocol, BTCXIndia launches in beta, Wisconsin Alderman Mark Clear accepts bitcoin campaign donations and then has to give them back, the DOD adds Bitcoin to its list of potential terrorist threats, Overstock.com hangs on to some of its bitcoin, BitPay plans to start using "bits" for bitcoin prices, Dogecoin-sponsored NASCAR driver Josh Wise races in Talladega, and we wrap up coverage of the recent Dogecon SF.

item.title: Josh Mohland of Dogetipbot @ Dogecon SF
item.description: Money & Tech's Sky Tallone interviewed Dogetipbot co-founder & CEO Josh Mohland at the recent Dogecon SF event in San Francisco. Watch to learn more about what Mohland calls "a service that lets you throw change at people on the internet in the form of Dogecoins" and how it works, as well as why he believes Dogecoin is "the most popular tipping currency on the internet" right now and will likely remain so. Mohland also praised Follow The Coin for pulling together an amazing Dogecon SF event in an impressively short two weeks.

item.title: Adam McKenna of Multipool @ Dogecon SF
item.description: Money & Tech's Sky Tallone spoke with Adam McKenna at the recent Dogecon SF event in San Francisco to talk about his multi-cryptocoin mining pool company, Multipool, which offers mining for dogecoin as well as 20 other scrypt coins such as litecoin and feathercoin. McKenna explains how Multipool allows users to mine the coins directly if they choose, or use a port that mines the most profitable coin at any given time, an option that he boasts being the first to offer and has contributed to the company's exponential growth (in user base and hash rate) over the last two months.

item.title: Nima Mahdjour of Coinjabber @ Dogecon SF
item.description: Money & Tech's Sky Tallone caught up with Nima Mahdjour from Coinjabber, a rating and review platform for cryptocurrency businesses and websites, at the recent Dogecon SF event in San Francisco. Mahdjour talks about how he first got excited about cryptocurrency, how he saw bitcoin as "bit torrent for money", and why he admires dogecoin most for its community. Mahdjour also shares about his cryptocurrency address shortener bit.co.in, which can help users get a shorter name for their wallet address that is easier to share with other people.

item.title: Dogecon SF's Costume Contest Winner
item.description: Money & Tech's Sky Tallone got to interview the Costume Contest winner, Andrew McKinsey of Last Wall, at the recent Dogecon SF event in San Francisco. Andrew went all out for the contest, shaving his chest hair in the shape of a shibe, and wearing nothing but a swim speedo and swimming cap.

item.title: 5/2/14 - Robocoin Bank, FXBTC shuts down, Bitcoin Foundation elections
item.description: Today in Money & Tech news, Robocoin turns their ATMs into Robocoin Bank branches, CAVirtex plans to launch bitcoin ATMs all over Canada, FXBTC shuts down while startup Bihang launches in China, Sen. item.title: Jackson Palmer @ Dogecon SF
item.description: Money & Tech's Sky Tallone attended the recent Dogecon SF event hosted by Follow The Coin. After the speakers' presentations, Sky caught up with the event's keynote speaker, Dogecoin creator Jackson Palmer, to talk about the key differences and similarities between Dogecoin and its fellow digital currencies Litecoin and Bitcoin, as well as how he felt this first San Francisco Dogecoin event went.

item.title: Money & Tech at The Rise And Rise Of Bitcoin Afterparty
item.description: Money & Tech attended the after-party for the Tribeca Film Festival premiere of Bitcoin documentary The Rise And Rise Of Bitcoin. Jered Kenna sat down with the film's director Nicholas Mross, producer Ben Bledsoe and protagonist Daniel Mross, as well as industry veterans Erik Voorhees and Tony Gallippi who came to support the film's debut in New York City.

item.title: Follow The Coin hosts DogeCon SF
item.description: Jered Kenna sat down with Tina Hui and Matt Schlicht from Follow The Coin to talk about their upcoming event, Dogecon SF, this Friday April 25th in San Francisco. This will be San Francisco's first dogecoin conference, so they have a lot of exciting things planned for the over 700 people who've already registered, such as fun games and costume contest, a special appearance from legendary Dogecoin tipper Hood, themed food & drinks, and a lineup of high-profile speakers including litecoin creator Charlie Lee, Andreas Antonopoulos, and of course, dogecoin creator Jackson Palmer. Although they are accepting donations, tickets to the event are completely free - though they have warned us that they are already over capacity. So if you aren't able to be there, you can still watch the livestream of the event at www.followthecoin.com/dogeconsf.

item.title: Jacob Hansen's CrowdCurity for Web Security
item.description: Jered Kenna sat down with Jacob Hansen, CEO and co-founder of crowdsourced IT startup CrowdCurity to learn about the services they offer to help web companies test and improve their security with cryptocurrency. Jacob also tells us about their new Capture The Coin program, a "capture the flag"-inspired contest which rewards security researchers for locating private bitcoin keys hidden within the front-end of its own website, as well as why major security breaches like that of Mt. Gox occurred and how they can be prevented in the future.

item.title: 4/21/14 - Japan bitcoin ATM, Paris Bitcoin Center, US Bitcoin Boulevard
item.description: In today's top news in Money & Tech, Bitcoin price rebounds & Sir Richard Branson calls it a pioneer, Japan's first bitcoin ATM arrives, Ossian Smyth is Ireland's first politician to embrace bitcoin, France gets its first bitcoin center in Paris, Cedar-Lee Road in Ohio becomes the world's 2nd Bitcoin Boulevard, SaveGox.com launches as a last attempt to prevent Mt. Gox liquidation, the NYC Bitcoin Center to host a bitcoin music festival, and CoSign Coin launches Secure Bitcoin Escrow with multi-sig. Also watch our interview with CrowdCurity CEO Jacob Hansen.

item.title: Ryan Charleston of Bitcorati @ Inside Bitcoins NY
item.description: Perianne Boring got to talk to Bitcorati.com founder and CEO Ryan Charleston at Inside Bitcoins NY about how his rating system for bitcoin companies works, by collecting financial, security and regulatory information on these businesses, to help develop greater trust and accountability in the bitcoin community and ecosystem.

item.title: Jonathan Mohan of Bitcoin NYC @ Inside Bitcoins NY
item.description: Jonathan Mohan, co-founder of the Bitcoin NYC professional network, spoke with Money & Tech's Perianne Boring at Inside Bitcoins NY about the current landscape of bitcoin, why he calls it anti-fragile, and what a worse case scenario might look like for its future.

item.title: BitShares @ Inside Bitcoins NY
item.description: Perianne Boring interviewed BitShares founder Daniel Larimer and director of marketing Brian Page at Inside Bitcoins NY about how they came up with their unique solution to help develop a new decentralized business model and further the analogy of bitcoin or digital currency as a company that has coins for shares.

item.title: Marc Hochstein of American Banker @ Inside Bitcoins NY
item.description: Executive Editor of daily banking industry newspaper American Banker Marc Hochstein spoke with Money & Tech's Perianne Boring at Inside Bitcoins NY about the reluctance from the commercial banking industry to work with bitcoin and accept bitcoin startups as clients, given the current compliance and regulatory concerns, and the risk of money laundering. Despite these hesitations, Marc thinks bitcoin holds a lot of potential, as more clarity emerges from the regulators.

item.title: Ken Majmudar of Ridgewood Investments @ Inside Bitcoins NY
item.description: Perianne Boring interviewed Ken Majmudar, founder of Ridgewood Investments, at Inside Bitcoins NY about the many ways he's been involved in the bitcoin space, from mining bitcoin and litecoin early on, to eventually starting to invest in and advise bitcoin startups. Ken explains how he still mines with mining pools, and why he doesn't always advise people to think about bitcoin as an investment.

item.title: Will O'Brien of BitGo @ Inside Bitcoins NY
item.description: Perianne Boring caught up with Will O'Brien, CEO and co-founder of BitGo, to talk about their exciing new developments around multi-signature technology, including their new BItGo Enterprise solution for bitcoin businesses that features spending and velocity limits, user management services, and 24/7 monitoring services. Will also talked about BitGo's new "cold key," their answer to cold storage, which means one of the 3 keys generated for your BitGo wallet is generated offline, making it even harder for thieves to get access to your funds.

item.title: Jake Benson & Libra For Your Bitcoin Taxes
item.description: Jered Kenna sat down with Jake Benson, CEO and Founder of Libra, on the day of the US tax deadline to talk about his coming product Libra Tax and how it will be invaluable for bitcoin users who need to calculate their capital gains taxes. Unfortunately, Libra Tax is not available yet, so Jake recommends that bitcoin users file their tax extension by today, for the extended deadline on October 15th, by which time Libra Tax will be launched and available for them.

item.title: 9 Year Old Explains Bitcoin
item.description: Money & Tech's Jered Kenna got to sit down with 9 year old bitcoin expert Sophie to get her unique perspective on the digital currency. Sophie shared her thoughts on the upsides and downsides of bitcoin, how & when bitcoin and banks can coexist, and why bitcoin is especially valuable and accessible to kids. She also shared her reaction to the Mt. Gox debaucle, and said perhaps the nicest thing anyone's ever said about the bankrupt exchange.

item.title: Money & Tech goes to Washington DC
item.description: Recently, Money & Tech visited Washington DC and Capitol Hill, to interview the US political and regulatory leaders about their views on virtual currency, and what role they think Congress and the US government should play in its adoption and regulation. We spoke with House Representatives Leonard Lance (R-NJ) and Alan Grayson (D-FL), and Senator Bernie Sanders (I-VT). You can also read a recap of our interview with staff members of Senator Tom Carper (D-DE) under the Articles section of our website.

item.title: Patrick Murck Explains Texas Banking Memo
item.description: Jered Kenna talked to Patrick Murck, Bitcoin Foundation General Counsel, about the new supervisory memorandum from the Texas Department of Banking, the first state in the US to offer their official stance. Patrick breaks down what the policies actually mean for virtual currencies, and why they demonstrate an encouragingly positive and open-minded outlook that he hopes other states will follow in example.

item.title: Pamir Gelenbe Wraps Up CoinSummit
item.description: In the wake of CoinSummit's recent raving success, we sat down with the event's fearless leader Pamir Gelenbe to look back at how it all went, what worked well, what themes were prevalent, and how he hopes to keep improving and growing the event in future iterations - starting with the next one in London this July.

item.title: Bobby Lee of BTC China @ CoinSummit
item.description: Perianne Boring interviewed BTC China CEO Bobby Lee at CoinSummit on Tuesday with Money & Tech. Watch to learn more about the largest digital currency exchange in China, and what challenges it faces with the many regulations and restrictions put out by the Chinese government and central bank, as well as the resulting negative reactions from much of the population in China and around the world. Despite these recent developments, Bobby Lee says he believes there is still huge potential for China, and is still pushing the technology forward.

item.title: Connie Gallippi of BitGive Foundation @ CoinSummit
item.description: Money & Tech's Jered Kenna sat down with Connie Gallippi, founder and Executive Director of the BitGive Foundation, the charitable giving foundation for the entire Bitcoin community. They talk about the foundation's mission to demonstrate Bitcoin's social value with the charitable aspect, to help the digital currency become more mainstream. Watch to learn more about BitGive's current campaign with The Water Project in Sub-Saharan Africa, as well as their previous efforts and plans for the future.

item.title: Chris David & Christa Clark of CoinVox @ CoinSummit
item.description: Perianne Boring sat down with Chris David and Christa Clark from CoinVox at CoinSummit in San Francisco, to talk about their upcoming payments platform that will revolutionize the world of political fundraising. item.title: Jesse Powell & Constance Choi on Kraken @ CoinSummit
item.description: Money & Tech's Jered Kenna sat down with Jesse Powell and Constance Choi from Payward Inc to talk about their digital currency exchange Kraken, including some breaking announcements on a successful $5 million Series A they just completed, and their plans tackle the regulatory world as they continue to expand around the world. Watch to learn more about their exciting news, what they've been accomplishing at CoinSummit, and what they will be up to next.

item.title: Adam Stradling on Coin4ce & CoinSummit
item.description: Money & Tech's Jered Kenna sat down with his old friend and former Tradehill colleague Adam Stradling, who is now Founder and CEO of Coin4ce, a fixed-rate exchange based in Chile driven to to facilitate the purchase, sale and use of Bitcoin in Latin America. Watch to learn more about Adam's latest venture, what they've accomplished so far, and how they plan to continue growing the Bitcoin community throughout Latin and South America.

item.title: SF Bitcoin Art Show & Meetup
item.description: Money & Tech's home base at 20Mission in San Francisco hosted the Bitcoin Art Show & Meetup earlier this month. We got to film the event and talk to some of the artists who had bitcoin-themed pieces on display, and hear how the cryptocurrency inspired them in their art as well as in their lives in general. Watch to see more of the awesome artwork and ideas that were featured at the event.

item.title: Texas Bitcoin Conference - MinerSource
item.description: Dan Murtha of MinerSource explained their offerings, both as an end-to-end hosting solutions provider, as well as a reseller of bitcoin mining hardware from manufacturers Black Arrow and BitMain. Dan also told us about CryptMint, which prints QR codes onto metal surfaces such as silver and copper coins, providing a more physically secure way to hold on to your bitcoins.

item.title: Texas Bitcoin Conference - Hashfast
item.description: Joe Russell walked us through Hashfast Technology's newest technology, their Sierra Evo, which features 3 of their Yoli Evo mining boards and operates at upwards of 2.0 TH/s. Their first batch sold out in the first week. But don't worry, their next batch is on sale now for $6,800, which will be shipped out in May.

item.title: Trace Mayer talks about Bitcoin
item.description: Entrepreneur, investor and early Bitcoin thought-leader Trace Mayer sat down with Money & Tech's Jered Kenna to talk about all things Bitcoin and digital currency, from the current arrests & regulations, to benefits of Bitcoin as "triple-entry bookkeeping" & the decentralized distributed ledger concept, to why it's so important to hold onto your own private keys.

item.title: Sina Khanifar & The Day We Fight Back
item.description: Entrepreneur and digital rights activist Sina Khanifar sat down with Money & Tech's Jered Kenna to talk about The Day We Fight Back, the massive online protest event he organized on February 11th against mass surveillance. This came at a critical time, as we're learning so much more about what the government is doing, and can respond with this call for action, to speak up and say "privacy is important and we won't stand for having our privacy taken away from us."

item.title: Tony Gallippi talks about BitPay
item.description: Money & Tech's Jered Kenna gets an exclusive interview with BitPay's CEO Tony Gallippi. Watch to hear all about this merchant services company that helps businesses get up and running accepting Bitcoin as a payment option, and how it can actually be an advantageous alternative payment method to credit cards in terms of fees, low overhead, charge backs, and global reach.

item.title: Breaking News 2/26 - Senator Manchin Calls for a Ban on Bitcoin
item.description: In today's breaking news story, U.S. Senator Joe Manchin (D-W.Va.) sent a letter to federal regulators including Fed Chair Janet Yellen this morning, seeking a ban on Bitcoin, and citing the deflationary nature, drugs, gambling and money laundering.
